critique: This document is an executive order regarding the inspection of tax returns by a House committee. It is difficult to assess its ideological tilt without more context, but it seems related to government oversight. Immigration is not relevant. The order grants access to tax returns, which could be seen as expanding executive power to some extent, although it is in response to a House resolution. Federalism is not directly addressed. The order could be seen as potentially impacting civil liberties related to privacy, but it is also related to national security in the sense of ensuring proper conduct in Federal courts. Economic regulation is not directly addressed. Social inclusion is not relevant. Therefore, the initial scores are as follows:
